alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 12:01AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Gusty Winds and cold wind chill temperatures are expected to continue as Arctic air mass moves into the region... Gusty winds in associated with the advance of a very cold Arctic air mass will continue across the area late tonight. Northwest winds with gusts around 30 mph are expected to continue into the early morning Friday. Temperatures have already fallen into the upper teens to 30s, leading to very cold wind chill temperatures in the single digits to 20s. The quickly falling temperatures and residual moisture on area surfaces that does not evaporate could flash freeze, producing slick, hazardous conditions overnight. Those with travel plans tonight and early Friday should be alert for slick spots on area roadways. Motorists should be alert for sudden gusts of wind, particularly in high profile vehicles, and on north south running highways. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio, or a favorite local media outlet, for further statements or updates from the National Weather Service in Huntsville.
